Description: The Temptation of St Antony. The saint lying on the floor in foreground, assailed by several demonic creatures; counterproof of second state with artist's name; after Camilo Procaccini Mezzotint
Curator's comments: This is a counterproof of Hollstein 219, for mezzotint in BM collection see 1850,1109.68.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (219.II) (counterproof)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Charles Francis Arnold Howard, 5th Earl of Wicklow
